executiveSummary: Major winter storm (Jan 21-23) created real-time validation opportunity for SOS value prop. Multiple state emergencies declared. FEMA releasing billions but workforce cuts create tech opportunity. Palantir surging on gov contracts. Crisis Cleanup actively deployed - potential integration partner.

urgentDeadlines.name: EDA Disaster Supplemental
urgentDeadlines.notes: NC Helene-eligible. Nonprofits can apply. 80% federal match.

newFunding.title: FEMA $2.2B Disaster Relief
newFunding.details: Released to 25 states for infrastructure repairs, debris removal, emergency costs
newFunding.relevance: Shows federal money still flowing despite workforce cuts

newFunding.title: Tennessee Helene Grants
newFunding.details: For communities affected by Tropical Storm Helene
newFunding.relevance: Tennessee active disaster state - potential pilot geography

newFunding.title: South Louisiana Hurricane Recovery
newFunding.details: Reimbursements to local government and nonprofit entities

newFunding.title: NC Helene Additional Funding
newFunding.details: For state recovery and future prevention
newFunding.relevance: NC still receiving funding - EDA application viable

policyWatch.title: Federal Disaster Funding Uncertainty
policyWatch.details: Feds reevaluating: when states qualify, how funds delivered, amount of federal support
policyWatch.impact: States may need tech solutions to do more with less federal support

headlines.title: Palantir CEO defends surveillance tech as US government contracts boost sales
headlines.details: Q4 revenue $1.41B exceeded estimates. Expects big jump in 2026 gov contract sales.

headlines.title: DHS $139.3M Contract Ongoing
headlines.details: 2022 investigative case management contract still active

palantir.analysis: Deep federal integration. Not direct SOS competitor but sets bar for gov tech credibility.

webEOC.notes: No new complaints found in search, but known frustration from prior research (duplicative data entry, switching costs)
webEOC.opportunity: Position SOS as complement/alternative for coordination layer

headlines.title: Crisis Cleanup Hotline Active in Tennessee
headlines.details: Hotline 844-965-1386 for winter storm victims. Active through Feb 13.

crisisCleanup.opportunity: PARTNERSHIP POTENTIAL - they handle cleanup coordination, SOS handles broader resource matching

aidArena.action: Get channel ID from Aid Arena team, Henry runs SQL update

voadActivity.title: New VOAD Chapter in Northeast Tennessee
voadActivity.details: Post-Helene formation. 'Dormancy is enemy of disaster resilience.'
voadActivity.opportunity: New VOAD chapters = potential early adopters for SOS

voadActivity.title: Nashville VOAD Prioritized for Winter Storm Fund
voadActivity.details: Mayor announced VOAD orgs get funded first from recovery fund. Using Charity Tracker.
voadActivity.insight: Charity Tracker in use - potential integration or competitor

crisisCleanup.details: Working with Tennessee VOAD, churches, community groups
crisisCleanup.partnership_angle: They coordinate volunteers for cleanup; SOS matches broader resources. Complementary.

activeDisasters.name: Winter Storm (Jan 21-23)
activeDisasters.federalResponse: NASA DRCS activated, Crisis Cleanup deployed
activeDisasters.sosRelevance: Real-time coordination chaos validates SOS value prop

femaChanges.title: FEMA Workforce Cuts
femaChanges.details: 41% cut to CORE disaster roles, 85% cut to surge staffing
femaChanges.impact: Less federal capacity = states need tech force multipliers
femaChanges.sosAngle: Position SOS as efficiency tool for reduced teams

femaChanges.title: Wildland Fire Consolidation
femaChanges.details: FY2026 plan to consolidate fire management across 5 agencies

stateEmaActivity.title: Comprehensive Disaster Recovery Plan Adopted
stateEmaActivity.details: New plan emphasizes locally-driven recovery with state guidance/coordination

stateEmaActivity.title: $30M to Contingency Fund
stateEmaActivity.relevance: States preparing to self-fund more disaster response

mediaSignals.title: Tech can avert catastrophic fires. What's missing is coordination
mediaSignals.summary: Op-ed arguing tech solutions exist but coordination is the gap
mediaSignals.sosValidation: DIRECT VALIDATION of SOS value proposition

mediaSignals.title: Guardian: Trump has left US less prepared for disasters
mediaSignals.summary: FEMA/NOAA cuts leaving states with more responsibility

keyTalkingPoints.point: Winter storm proves coordination gap is real
keyTalkingPoints.evidence: 5+ states declared emergencies. Crisis Cleanup deployed. VOAD chapters forming. Media calling out 'coordination' as the missing piece.
keyTalkingPoints.use: Partner walkthrough - validation of problem we're solving

keyTalkingPoints.evidence: FEMA cutting 41% of disaster roles. States allocating own funds (NM $30M). Pew report on funding uncertainty.
keyTalkingPoints.use: Position SOS as force multiplier for stretched teams

keyTalkingPoints.evidence: $2.2B just released. $326M to LA. $116M to NC. $9M to TN.
keyTalkingPoints.use: Grant funding available - EDA March 3 deadline is real opportunity

keyTalkingPoints.point: Crisis Cleanup is a potential partner, not competitor
keyTalkingPoints.evidence: They handle volunteer coordination for cleanup. We handle broader resource matching. Complementary.
keyTalkingPoints.use: Partnership conversation if they come up

immediateActions.details: Get Slack channel ID, run SQL update, test match announcements
March 3 deadline. NC eligibility. Start drafting.
